III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/11/2025 a female youth was observed on the road
screaming loudly. The youth yelled to a staff not to push them.
Staff dragged the youth back to the facility.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 7/17/2025.
Complainant reported witnessing the allegations from 400 yards
away.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported she was restrained by Staff 1 as she was in the middle of
the road. Youth A reported Staff 1 restrained her in a standing
position and transitioned to a seated position and described her
arms being secured in the facilities approved restraint model.
Youth A reported she did not recall what other staff were present.
Youth A reported Staff 1 released her from the restraint, and she
walked on her own back to the facility. Youth A reported no
concerns with the restraint. Youth A reported she was never
pushed by any staff during the incident nor was she dragged back
to the facility. Youth A reported a construction worker came
running from the bridge down the road as she was yelling and
screaming. Youth A reported she was restrained in a seated
position and was never on her stomach in a prone position.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported she did not witness Youth A’s restraint however has
witnessed other restraints at the facility and has no concerns with
the restraints she has witnessed.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2
reported Youth A was walking toward the road and Staff 1 was
following so he and Staff 3 went to assist. Staff 2 reported he and
Staff 1 attempted to talk to Youth A and used verbal de-escalation
tools to try to get Youth A to return to the facility, however Youth A
2

continued to walk in the road and pushed through Staff 1 to walk
toward the bridge where construction work was being completed.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 placed Youth A in a single person upper
torso restraint for safety as Youth A was walking in the road and
was not following directives to get out of the road. Staff 2 reported
Youth A dropped her weight in the restraint at which time Staff 1
transitioned to a seated upper torso restraint. Staff 2 reported
Staff 1 never pushed Youth A nor did any staff. Staff 2 reported
Youth A ran at Staff 1 and Staff 1 put his arms up at which time
Youth A ran into Staff 1’s arms. Staff 2 reported Youth A was in
the restraint for a few minutes and Staff 1 released Youth A then
Youth A walked on her own back to the facility. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was never dragged.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 and Staff 4 were with Youth A and her and Staff 2
went to assist. Staff 3 reported Youth A was trying to run into the
road and was placed in an upper torso restraint by Staff 1 and
transitioned to a seated upper torso restraint. Staff 3 reported
Youth A was transitioned to the seated position per the facilities
trained restraint model. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 nor any staff ever
pushed Youth A nor was Youth A dragged back to the facility.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was released from the restraint and
walked back to the facility on her own.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4
reported he witnessed Youth A walking away from the facility and
Staff 1 following so he went to assist. Staff 4 reported Youth A
attempted to walk into the road several times and Staff 1 used
proximity control to try to keep Youth A out of the road. Staff 4
reported Staff 2 came to assist and Youth A was being prompted
to stay out of the road. Staff 4 reported Youth A began pushing
through Staff 1 to go into the road and Staff 1 placed Youth A in a
seated upper torso restraint. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 nor any staff
ever pushed Youth A or dragged Youth A back to the facility. Staff
4 reported Youth A was released from the restraint and walked
back to the facility on her own.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
reported Youth A was restrained by Staff 1 and Staff 2, Staff 3,
and Staff 4 were present. Administrator reported no knowledge of
Youth A being pushed or dragged by staff. Administrator reported
no concerns with how Staff 1 performs restraints.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 7/23/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was upset and made statements she was leaving the facility and
going to “kill herself”. Staff 1 reported he followed Youth A and
attempted to calm Youth A down. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
getting near the road and was trying to walk into the road. He
used proximity control to keep Youth A out of the road. Staff 1
reported Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 came to assist. Staff 1
reported Youth A pushed through him to go into the road at which
time he placed Youth A in a standing upper torso restraint. Staff 1
reported Youth A dropped her body weight at which time he
transitioned Youth A into a seated upper torso restraint. Staff 1
reported the restraint lasted less than two minutes. Youth A
agreed to a safety plan then Youth A was released from the
restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth A walked back to the facility on
her own. Staff 1 denied Youth A being pushed at any time by him
or any other staff and denied Youth A being dragged back to the
facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 216140262 for Youth A dated 7/11/2025:
Youth A walked into the road and was not following staff
directions to stay out of the road, Youth A began pushing
Staff 1 to continue to stay in the middle of the road. Youth
A was placed in a single person upper torso restraint by
Staff 1 and transitioned into a seated upper torso restraint
due to Youth A kicking her legs and resisting the restraint.
Staff de-escalated Youth A and Youth A was released from
the restraint.
• Youth Opportunity Osceola Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention: The following are
prohibited practices: Any type of physical punishment
including, but not limited to: hitting or striking, throwing,
kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of their
body.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had one discipline in his
personnel file dated 7/26/2025 for being tardy to work and
received Safe Crisis Management training on 3/19/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance per interviews with Youth A,
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 Youth A was never pushed by
any staff nor was Youth A dragged back to the facility.
4

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Description restraints; elimination of restraints
(5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member picked the youth up from behind and slammed the
youth on the ground.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 7/17/2025.
Complainant reported witnessing the allegations from 400 yards
away.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported she was never picked up from behind and slammed to
the ground.
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were interviewed face-to-face at
the facility on 7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker,
separately. Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 all reported Youth A was
never picked up and slammed to the ground.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 7/23/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was never picked up and slammed to the ground.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 216140262 for Youth A dated 7/11/2025:
Youth A was placed in a standing upper torso single person
restraint and transitioned to a seated upper torso restraint
by Staff 1.
• Youth Opportunity Osceola Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention: Restraint must be
5

performed in a manner that is safe, appropriate and
proportionate to youth.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had one discipline in his
personnel file dated 7/26/2025 for being tardy to work and
received Safe Crisis Management training on 3/19/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance per interviews with Youth A,
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4, Youth A was never picked up
and slammed to the ground.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Description restraints; elimination of restraints
(2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
(e) Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
restricts the youth's airway.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The staff member laid on the youth's back holding the youth down.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 7/17/2025.
Complainant reported witnessing the allegations from 400 yards
away.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported she was restrained in a seated position and was never
on her stomach in a prone position with any staff on her back.
Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were interviewed face-to-face at
the facility on 7/17/2025 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker,
separately. Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 all reported Youth A was
placed in a standing upper torso restraint by Staff 1 and Youth A
dropped her weight at which time Staff 1 transitioned Youth A to a
seated upper torso restraint. Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 all
reported Youth A was never in a prone restraint and no staff ever
laid on Youth A in any way.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 7/23/2025 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied Youth A ever
being in a prone restraint and no staff ever laid on Youth A’s back.
Documents Reviewed:
6

• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 216140262 for Youth A dated 7/11/2025
states Youth A was placed in a single person upper torso
restraint by Staff 1 and transitioned to a seated upper torso
restraint.
• Youth Opportunity Osceola Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention: prone restraint is
prohibited.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had one discipline in his
personnel file dated 7/26/2025 for being tardy to work and
received Safe Crisis Management training on 3/19/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as based on interviews with
Youth A, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 Youth A was never in
a prone restraint with staff holding the youth down. Per interviews
Youth A was placed in a standing upper torso restraint by Staff 1
and transitioned to a seated upper torso restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting
Description (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not approve the incident report in 72 hours.
Investigation Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 216140262 for Youth A dated 7/11/2025
was approved 7/15/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the incident report was
dated 7/11/2025 and was not approved in MiSACWIS within the
72-hour requirement.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
